alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 26 at 2:50AM CST until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Whiteside, Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. Rock River at Moline affecting Rock Island and Henry IL Counties. .Expected heavy rainfall will potentially cause flooding on the lower Rock River in Illinois. At this time, the exact amount of rain and runoff is not certain for Sunday night and Monday morning. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River at Moline. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Water affects some residences in the lower Friendship Farm area. 60th St is under water south of the Green Valley Sports Complex. 56th St along the north side of the river is under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM CST Sunday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued late this morning.
